pageContext.description: Point, mouth of socket, edges of blade-wings broken and jagged. The broken edges for their greater part are ancient, though golden bronzes shows in a few patches. Socket extends 27mm up from the present mouth.
pageContext.patina: Grass-green patina, with streaks of lighter shade green underlying it; below this a few traces of bronze colour.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection (FEb. 1936),W.R. Hughes,21 Elm Road,Welwyn Garden City, Herts.
pageContext.site: England,Hertfordshire,Upper Tewin,Found (Jan. 1936) while digging foundations for a new bungalow-colony in Sewell's Orchard. Approximate site marked.
